@graph.name: Chicken Alfredo Recipe {Easy and Amazing!} - Belly Full
@graph.description: This easy Chicken Alfredo recipe includes golden pan-fried chicken breasts and tender noodles, coated in the most dreamy cream sauce ever!

@graph.name: Amy
@graph.description: Well, hey there! Amy here. Welcome to my little corner of the internet! If you’re looking for tried and true, fuss-free, budget-friendly, delicious, every day recipes, you’ve come to the right place.

@graph.name: Chicken Alfredo
@graph.description: This easy Chicken Alfredo recipe includes golden pan-fried chicken breasts and tender noodles, coated in the most dreamy cream sauce ever!

video.name: Chicken Alfredo
video.description: This easy Chicken Alfredo recipe includes golden pan-fried seasoned chicken breasts and tender noodles, coated in the most dreamy cream sauce ever. A showstopper meal and it's all done in just over 30 minutes!

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup butter (, cut into large cubes or slices)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the noodles: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook until al dente according to package directions, usually 10 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, then drain well. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the noodles: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook until al dente according to package directions, usually 10 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, then drain well. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the chicken: Season chicken breasts with the Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the chicken: Season chicken breasts with the Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Once it’s shimmering, swirl the pan to evenly distribute. Add the chicken and leave it undisturbed for 5-7 minutes, until the bottom is golden-brown. Flip over and add in 1 tablespoon of butter between them, picking up the pan to give it a gentle swirl to distribute. Continue cooking for another 5-7 minutes (or an internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F.)
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Once it’s shimmering, swirl the pan to evenly distribute. Add the chicken and leave it undisturbed for 5-7 minutes, until the bottom is golden-brown. Flip over and add in 1 tablespoon of butter between them, picking up the pan to give it a gentle swirl to distribute. Continue cooking for another 5-7 minutes (or an internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F.)

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and let rest for 3 minutes. Cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Tent with foil while you prepare the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and let rest for 3 minutes. Cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Tent with foil while you prepare the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Alfredo sauce: In the same pan, over medium-low heat, add the butter and cream; whisk until butter has melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Alfredo sauce: In the same pan, over medium-low heat, add the butter and cream; whisk until butter has melted.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the minced garlic, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper; whisk until combined and smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the minced garlic, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper; whisk until combined and smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a gentle simmer (do not boil) and cook for 3-4 minutes, whisking constantly, until it starts to thicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a gentle simmer (do not boil) and cook for 3-4 minutes, whisking constantly, until it starts to thicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the parmesan cheese just until melted and the sauce is smooth. (If the sauce ends up too thick, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water, a few tablespoons at a time, to thin it out.)
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the parmesan cheese just until melted and the sauce is smooth. (If the sauce ends up too thick, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water, a few tablespoons at a time, to thin it out.)

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble: Take sauce off the heat and immediately toss with the cooked fettuccine noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble: Take sauce off the heat and immediately toss with the cooked fettuccine noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the pasta among serving bowls and top with a few slices of chicken. Garnish with parsley, more Parmesan, and black pepper if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the pasta among serving bowls and top with a few slices of chicken. Garnish with parsley, more Parmesan, and black pepper if desired.
